revised_title: A Comparative Study of Optical and X-ray Novae
tldr: This article compares the similarities and differences between optical novae and transient X-ray novae, discussing their binary structures and theoretical models. Both classes of novae are believed to require a semidetached binary system, with mass transfer via a stellar wind or Roche lobe overflow onto a compact companion. The author reviews present theoretical models for both types of novae, which are based on nuclear burning or accretion energy sources.
